/-- If `G : D â¥¤ C` is a right adjoint it satisfies the solution set condition.  -/
theorem solution_set_condition_of_is_right_adjoint [IsRightAdjoint G] : SolutionSetCondition G :=
  by
  intro A
  refine' âŸ¨PUnit, fun _ => (left_adjoint G).obj A, fun _ => (adjunction.of_right_adjoint G).unit.app A, _âŸ©
  intro B h
  refine' âŸ¨PUnit.unit, ((adjunction.of_right_adjoint G).hom_equiv _ _).symm h, _âŸ©
  rw [â† adjunction.hom_equiv_unit, Equiv.apply_symm_apply]
#align solution_set_condition_of_is_right_adjoint solution_set_condition_of_is_right_adjoint
has_colimits_of_has_limits_of_is_cosepar:
/-- A consequence of the special adjoint functor theorem: if `C` is complete, well-powered and
    has a small coseparating set, then it is cocomplete. -/
theorem has_colimits_of_has_limits_of_is_coseparating [HasLimits C] [WellPowered C] {ğ’¢ : Set C} [Small.{v} ğ’¢]

    has_colimits_of_shape := fun J hJ =>
      has_colimits_of_shape_iff_is_right_adjoint_const.2
        âŸ¨is_right_adjoint_of_preserves_limits_of_is_coseparating hğ’¢ _âŸ© }
#align has_colimits_of_has_limits_of_is_coseparating has_colimits_of_has_limits_of_is_coseparating
